com.jacobschneider.engine

Class Simulation

  • Object
    • Simulation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EventListener, GLEventListener

    public final class Simulation
extends Object
implements GLEventListener
    A convenience class to display a simulation. Handles creating a window, displaying the graphics of a universe, handling input, and incrementally updating a universe's physics. All you have to do is create a universe object and pass it into a static factory method. This class also automatically creates a very basic InputHandler with controls that map to WASD (translation) and the arrow keys (rotation). You can notify other objects of these inputs by implementing InputListener and adding it to addListener(InputListener). A call startSim() will begin the simulation.
    Author:
    Jacob

    • Method Detail

      • createSimulation

        public static Simulation createSimulation(Universe uni)
        Entry to point to the simulation. Creates a 1920x1080 60 Hz simulation. Create a Universe object and pass it in here to create the simulation.
        Parameters:
        uni - The universe that will be simulated
        Returns:
        The simulation object that is created.

      • createSimulation

        public static Simulation createSimulation(Universe uni,
                                          int width,
                                          int height,
                                          int fps)
        Entry to point to the simulation. Create a Universe object and pass it in here to create the simulation.
        Parameters:
        uni - the universe that will be simulated
        width - width of simulation window in pixels
        height - height of simulation window in pixels
        fps - refresh rate of the simulation window in hz
        Returns:
        The simulation object that is created

      • startSim

        public final void startSim()
        Begins the simulation. Launches a window, starts the physics, and starts the graphics.

      • addListener

        public void addListener(InputListener listener)
        Adds an InputListener to the simulation. Any listener added here will be delegated input commands based on the order they are added.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener to add

        public void setBackgroundColor(Color color)

        Parameters:

      • setTimeScale

        public void setTimeScale(float timeScale)
        Sets the time scale for the simulation. A time scale of 1.0 is real time.
        Parameters:
        timeScale - Number of seconds that occurs in the simulation proportional to the number of seconds that occur in the real world.

      • setCamera

        public void setCamera(Vector3 camPos,
                      Vector3 lookAtPos,
                      Vector3 up)
        Sets the state of the camera.
        Parameters:
        camPos - Position vector in space
        lookAtPos - Position the camera is pointing towards
        up - The up direction of the camera

      • setCameraAttrib

        public void setCameraAttrib(float fieldOfView,
                            float minDist,
                            float maxDist)
        Sets the attributes of the camera
        Parameters:
        fieldOfView - Camera's field of view in degrees.
        minDist - Minimum distance the camera will render.
        maxDist - Maximum distance the camera will render.

      • showFrameData

        public void showFrameData(boolean showFrameData)
        Console prints the time it takes to iterate through 10,000 physics frames as the simulation is running.
        Parameters:
        showFrameData - Whether frame information should be printed to console.
